column2: and her cottage was just beyond the churchyard
column3: on the other side from our house. On the different military occasions which I have remarked upon this widow woman stood at her garden gate and looked on. And after the cheering she rubbed her eyes with her apron. Alice noticed this slight but signifying action.We feel quite sure Mrs Simpkins liked soldiers
column4: and so we felt friendly to her. But when we tried to talk to her she would not. She told us to go along with us
column6: and not bother her. And Oswald
column7: with his usual delicacy and good breeding
column8: made the others do as she said.But we were not to be thus repulsed with impunity. We made complete but cautious inquiries
column9: and found out that the reason she cried when she saw soldiers was that she had only one son
column11: and he had gone to the War last April. So that she thought of him when she saw the soldiers
column12: and that was why she cried.
